result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Joseph Grabowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Benjamin Joseph Grabowski.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Defense counsel advises that parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an adjourned plea/sentencing date. No objections from the State. Court grants request, and advises that she has no objection to this matter being resolved as part of a global resolution from Br 1. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  With the court's permission and with the acceptance of Br 16, this matter will be scheduled in Br 16 for global resolution.  mn  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Domask requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  
Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Domask requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Benjamin Joseph Grabowski in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Joseph Grabowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/12/2022@1:30pm
